posts.title: Save for the rainy days
posts.content: Save for the rainy days is a proverb that encourages saving money to prepare for future difficulties or unexpected expenses.

posts.title: The 50/30/20 Rule
posts.content: The 50/30/20 rule is a simple budgeting method that divides your after-tax income into three categories: 50% for needs, 30% for wants, and 20% for savings and debt repayment.

posts.title: Chief Financial Officer
posts.content: The Chief Financial Officer (CFO) is a high-ranking executive who holds the primary responsibility for managing an organization's finances.
